result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony L Elliott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive with any other sentence. The first 90 days STRAIGHT TIME and remainder with Huber release for job search, school or treatment.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample; pay surcharge (unless previously done). All mandatory court costs, fees and assessments to be paid during the period of probation. If revoked, to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Pay all applicable fees of supervision.
- Restitution set at $0.00.

- Maintain or seek verifiable full-time employment or education or vocational training, when physically able.
- Obtain GED or HSED.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

- No possession, use, sale, or distribution of any illegal drugs; no association with any location where illegal substances are consumed, packaged or sold.
- No possession of any firearms or ammunition.
- NO CONTACT with Tyrese Nicholson or Mookie Montel Matthews.

- Defendant to contact probation immediately.
- Agent to notify Court upon second positive test for drugs.
- Comply with all rules of probation and any other conditions deemed appropriate by your Agent or the Court.
- Cooperate with Agent.

- AODA assessment; comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Undergo random urine screens (no rights to refuse screens, refusal will be treated as a positive test result) and HOC time could result from a positive test.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony L Elliott

records.addlTxt: Addendum to Plea Questionnaire / Waiver, received and filed

Defendant Anthony L Elliott in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Anthony L Elliott.  Intern Levi Keeku, under supervision of Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1 : Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, body armor, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1 : Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive with any other sentence, with credit for 6 DAYS served, the first 90 days straight time and remainder with Huber release for job search, school or treatment.    The court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- 30 days condition time STAYED.
- Absolute sobriety.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- No possession, use, sale, or distribution of any illegal drugs; no association with any location where illegal substances are consumed, packaged or sold.
- Undergo random urine screens (no right to refuse screens, refusal will be treated as a positive test result) and HOC time could result from a positive test. 
- Agent to notify Court upon second positive test for drugs.
- Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge (unless previously done).
- Pay all applicable fees of supervision.
- No possession of any firearms or ammunition.
- Maintain or seek verifiable full time employment or education or vocational training, when physically able. 
- Obtain GED or HSED.
- Comply with all rules of probation and any other conditions deemed appropriate by your agent or the court.
- Cooperate with agent.
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid during the period of probation. If revoked, to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- No contact with Tyrese Nicholson or Mookie Montel Matthews.
- Defendant to contact probation immediately

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Defendant Anthony L Elliott in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Anthony L Elliott.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests a Plea and Sentencing date be set.  Plea documents shall be filed at least 3 days prior to hearing date. Case adjourned to Br. 9. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony L Elliott in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask, who appears via video.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Scheduling conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State.  Defense requests additional time to review offer.  Court grants request and set this for Adjourned Scheduling conference.  Parties to appear in person. Case adjourned to Br. 9  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Anthony L Elliott in court, appear in person with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask, appear in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea

Defendant Anthony L Elliott in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Anthony L Elliott in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony L Elliott appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
